description: Eczema, also known as atopic dermatitis, is a long-term (chronic) inflammatory skin condition that causes itchy, dry, and inflamed skin.  It's characterized by recurring flare-ups and periods of remission.
most_likely_cause_of_disease: Genetic predisposition (family history of eczema, asthma, or hay fever)
Environmental triggers (allergens like pollen, dust mites, pet dander; irritants like soaps, detergents, fabrics)
precautions_we_need_to_take: Identify and avoid triggers (allergens and irritants)
Moisturize skin regularly with fragrance-free, hypoallergenic lotions or creams
Take lukewarm showers and avoid hot water
Use mild, fragrance-free soaps and detergents
See a dermatologist for appropriate treatment and management
symptoms_of_that_disease: Raw, cracked skin that weeps or bleeds
Darkening of the skin (hyperpigmentation) in affected areas
diet_we_need_to_follow: No specific diet is universally recommended for all eczema sufferers. However, some people find that eliminating certain foods (e.g., common allergens like dairy, eggs, nuts, soy) may help reduce symptoms.  A balanced diet rich in fruits, vegetables, and whole grains is generally recommended.
Staying hydrated by drinking plenty of water is important for overall skin health.
affect_of_disease: Skin infections (if the skin barrier is compromised)
